paper_abstract: This paper describes the design and implementation of a dual-eye multispectral iris capture handheld device with one camera, which consists of the following four parts: 1) capture unit; 2) illumination unit; 3) interaction unit; and 4) control unit. A multispectral iris image database is created by the proposed capture device, and then, we use the multispectral score-level fusion to further investigate the effectiveness of the proposed capture device by the 1-D Log-Gabor wavelet filter approach. Experimental results are also presented in this paper.
paper_title: Handheld System Design for Dual-Eye Multispectral Iris Capture With One Camera
